_header: Gaude of virgins the freshest flower

Longleat30.First Lines:
GAude of virgins þe fresshest floureIn maydenhede a lantern of
                    odoure…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…Nor neue fade nor neuer decreseBut be fresche and dure and
                    euer encresePer eterna secula Amen
Longleat30.Note:
Fourteen monorhyming 3-line stanzas, with rubric Latin headings for
                    each, including Septem gaudia beate marie before first and Per eterna
                        secula amen after last.

HunHM142.First Lines:
GAude of uirgins þe freshest floureIn maydenhede a
                    launtern of odour…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…Nor neuer fade ne neuer decreceBut be freshe and dure and
                    euer encrece
HunHM142.Note:
Fourteen monorhyming 3-line stanzas, with rubric Latin headings for
                    each, including Septem gaudia beate marie before first and Per eterna
                        secula amen after last.
HunHM142.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 61-2.
